condition.description:
Schizophrenia is a serious brain illness. People who have it may hear voices that aren't there. They may think other people are trying to hurt them. Sometimes they don't make sense when they talk. The disorder makes it hard for them to keep a job or take care of themselves.

Symptoms of schizophrenia usually start between ages 16 and 30. Men often develop symptoms at a younger age than women. People usually do not get schizophrenia after age 45. There are three types of symptoms:

  • Psychotic symptoms distort a person's thinking. These include hallucinations (hearing or seeing things that are not there), delusions (beliefs that are not true), trouble organizing thoughts, and strange movements.
  • "Negative" symptoms make it difficult to show emotions and to function normally. A person may seem depressed and withdrawn.
  • Cognitive symptoms affect the thought process. These include trouble using information, making decisions, and paying attention.

No one is sure what causes schizophrenia. Your genes, environment, and brain chemistry may play a role.

There is no cure. Medicine can help control many of the symptoms. You may need to try different medicines to see which works best. You should stay on your medicine for as long as your doctor recommends. Additional treatments can help you deal with your illness from day to day. These include therapy, family education, rehabilitation, and skills training.

NIH: National Institute of Mental Health

basics.benefits_moa: Abilify is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Abilify is good for treating psychosis and mania, and can help with depression. Less likely to cause side effects than any other antipsychotic, but has a risk of suicidal thoughts for people age 24 and younger.
downsides: Mild risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.
Not available as a generic, so it's more expensive.

Studies show that it can also be helpful for depression, especially in women, if your symptoms don't go away with an antidepressant alone.

userStories.tip: I was on Abilify for almost 8 months with no improvement in depression, in fact I became a depressed tank! Within 7 months, I went from 130 to 180 lbs., I'm  5'2"!! Pdoc didn't seemed concerned, but my rheumatologist sure did.

The Dr. prescribed  5mg Abilify in addition to 40 mg Prozac for my daughter's Anxiety Disorders.   She was 10 years old (now 11).  She gained 30 pounds in 11 months.  Discontinuing Abilify now.  Considering Latuda??
It is really expensive if you don't have insurance, but I seem to feel a lot better and more present in my own mind.

I have taken this for one day and I cannot eat, drink, or even move without severe nausea and sweating. I'm becoming more psychotic as I can compare this 100% to Risperidone. I've had suicidal thoughts and have been becoming angry.
I just wanted to sleep all the time.

All it does is makes you sick to your stomach and not able to sleep. Then when I stop I find my food & drink are being laced with it. BEWARE THIS PHARMA COMPANY IS A BUNCH OF STALKERS! DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING FROM THEM!
My brain felt great, but my body did not - experienced weight gain and severe constipation.
Damaging effects of the drug.

Insomnia every night. If you can't sleep you can't function. Nausea, diahreehea, anxiety, low blood sugar, hypoglycaemia which causes, weakness, dizziness and fatigue. When I wasn't nauseas, I was starving. If I slept, hunger would wake me.
Can cause blood sugar to go so high you get pancreatitis
I ended up having to take only 2.5 mg per day so I wouldn't fall asleep driving. It is hard to cut up a 10 mg tablet into fourths but it seemed to help.
Always keep a steady supply so you don't run out. Withdrawals are no fun. I felt an electric shock sensation all throughout my body
ugh. tried coming off it, made me suicidal. now i'm back on
taking for bi polar and depression
Abilify caused severe constipation for me. To the point that I had to stop taking it. I tried everything that would normal help with constipation and none of it worked.

userStories.tip: I found taking it in the late afternoon helps better than before bed. Also try your best to avoid alcohol, weed (or harder drugs) and cigarettes - from personal experience it all messes with your brain and make it less effective.

Worst medicine ever for bipolar II disorder. Vision impairment. I couldn't clearly see road signs due to the blurred vision, let alone a computer screen. Constant joint itching. Could not sit still. Embarrassed as I looked like a "tweaker".

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Abilify is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Abilify is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Abilify may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Abilify is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Abilify may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Abilify is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Abilify can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Abilify can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Abilify causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Abilify causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Abilify is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Abilify is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Abilify is the least likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Abilify is the least likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can cause you to gain weight. Abilify is the least likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can cause you to gain weight. Abilify is the least likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Abilify impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Abilify impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Phenylketonuria (PKU)
risks_warnings.description: Abilify Discmelt contains Aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take the  Discmelt. You can still take the oral swallow tablet.

carousel_items: Take Clozapine exactly as prescribed and don't stop taking it without talking to your doctor.
Can cause dizziness or drowsiness. Avoid alcohol and be careful when changing positions or doing anything that requires your full attention until you know how Clozapine affects you.
Blood tests are needed before you start this medicine and before every refill. You need to pick up the medicine within 7 days of your blood tests.
Can affect your weight, cholesterol, and blood sugar control.

basics.benefits_moa: Clozapine is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Clozapine treats schizophrenia when other drugs haven't worked, but you'll have to get blood work done regularly and can have weight gain.
downsides: You need to get blood work done every time you can get a prescription filled for Clozapine.
You can only get Clozapine at certain pharmacies that are registered to provide it.
If you don't get Clozapine within 7 days of it being ready at the pharmacy, then you have to get blood work done again and get a new prescription from your doctor.
You need to limit the amount of alcohol you drink while on Clozapine.

If you don't get Clozapine within 7 days of it being ready at the pharmacy, then you have to get blood work done again and get a new prescription from your doctor.
You need to limit the amount of alcohol you drink while on Clozapine.

upsides: Clinical studies show that Clozapine is effective in treating schizophrenia when other medications have failed.
Has the lowest risk of causing movement problems when compared to other antipsychotic medicines.
Clozapine is available as a normal tablet and as a mint-flavored tablet that dissolves on the tongue without water.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Clozapine exactly as prescribed and don't stop taking it without talking to your doctor.
Can cause dizziness or drowsiness. Avoid alcohol and be careful when changing positions or doing anything that requires your full attention until you know how Clozapine affects you.
Blood tests are needed before you start this medicine and before every refill. You need to pick up the medicine within 7 days of your blood tests.
Can affect your weight, cholesterol, and blood sugar control.

risks_warnings.title: Fewer white blood cells
risks_warnings.description: People on Clozapine can lose white blood cells. This makes it harder for the body to fight off infections, and people have died from it. You need to have blood work done every time before your doctor can write a new or refill prescription for Clozapine to make sure you're not at risk.

description_processed.orig: People on Clozapine can lose white blood cells. This makes it harder for the body to fight off infections, and people have died from it. You need to have blood work done every time before your doctor can write a new or refill prescription for Clozapine to make sure you're not at risk.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure | Slow heartbeat | Fainting
risks_warnings.description: You can be at high risk for low blood pressure and a slower heartbeat while on Clozapine, especially if you're on medications for high blood pressure or if you're dehydrated. This can cause fainting and falling if you're not careful. Drink plenty of liquids throughout the day, and talk to your doctor to see if your medications for your blood pressure need to be changed.

description_processed.orig: You can be at high risk for low blood pressure and a slower heartbeat while on Clozapine, especially if you're on medications for high blood pressure or if you're dehydrated. This can cause fainting and falling if you're not careful. Drink plenty of liquids throughout the day, and talk to your doctor to see if your medications for your blood pressure need to be changed.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: People on Clozapine have reported having seizures. The risk gets higher with increasing dose or if you have conditions that make you more likely to have seizures, like alcohol abuse. If you're on medications because you've had seizures in the past, talk to your doctor to see if the medications need to be adjusted.

description_processed.orig: People on Clozapine have reported having seizures. The risk gets higher with increasing dose or if you have conditions that make you more likely to have seizures, like alcohol abuse. If you're on medications because you've had seizures in the past, talk to your doctor to see if the medications need to be adjusted.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: People on Clozapine have had issues with their heart, including swelling of the heart muscles (myocarditis) or other problems with the heart muscles (cardiomyopathy). This can be fatal. Call your doctor immediately if you have chest pain, a fast heartbeat or other problems with your heartbeat, fainting, or flu-like symptoms.

description_processed.orig: People on Clozapine have had issues with their heart, including swelling of the heart muscles (myocarditis) or other problems with the heart muscles (cardiomyopathy). This can be fatal. Call your doctor immediately if you have chest pain, a fast heartbeat or other problems with your heartbeat, fainting, or flu-like symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people over 65 years old and who have dementia that have died after taking Clozapine to treat psychiatric problems caused by their dementia.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people over 65 years old and who have dementia that have died after taking Clozapine to treat psychiatric problems caused by their dementia.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: People on Clozapine have reported weight gain. This is common. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor about what you can do to stop this from happening.

risks_warnings.title: Increased cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: People on Clozapine have reported increased cholesterol. Talk to your doctor to reduce your risk of heart problems because of increased cholesterol, or if your medications need to be changed if you already have high cholesterol.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS)
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Clozapine who have had neuroleptic malignant syndrome, which can be fatal. This is very rare, but call your doctor immediately if you notice a high fever, rigid muscles, confusion, an irregular heartbeat, and unusual sweating.

risks_warnings.title: Tardive dyskinesia
risks_warnings.description: People on Clozapine can be more likely to have tardive dyskinesia, which can make you unable to control your movements. This is very rare and can be stopped if you stop taking the medication. If you notice that you can't control your movements, or if you notice shaking or trembling that you can't stop on your own, call your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Return of schizophrenic symptoms
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Clozapine without talking to your doctor, since your symptoms of schizophrenia can come back. You can also have increased sweating, diarrhea, headache, nausea and vomiting. Talk to your doctor if you want to stop taking Clozapine.

basics.benefits_moa: Geodon is a second generation antipsychotic. It treats schizophrenia and bipolar disorder by adjusting the levels of dopamine and serotonin in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Geodon treats bipolar disorder and schizophrenia, and causes fewer side effects than similar medicines. Itâ€™s not a good choice if you have heart problems.
downsides: Elderly people with dementia shouldnâ€™t take Geodon.

You shouldnâ€™t take Geodon if you have a history of heart problems (slow heart rate, recent heart attack, heart failure, or heart rhythm problems). Itâ€™s also not safe to take if you have low potassium or magnesium, or are taking medicines that increase the risk of this happening (diuretics).
You'll need to get blood tests before you start taking Geodon.
It causes slightly less weight gain than similar medicines.

upsides: Geodon can be used with lithium or valproate to better treat bipolar disorder.

Compared to other antipsychotics, it has a lower risk of weight gain, hyperglycemia, and hyperlipidemia.
The Geodon capsule is available as a generic.
The injectable form can treat sudden agitation in schizophrenia when it's not possible to use the capsules.
It's available as a pill that you take by mouth daily for continuous treatment and as an injection used for short-term treatment of agitation.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Geodon is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Geodon may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Tell your doctor immediately if you have unusual thoughts or feel like your symptoms are getting worse.

description_processed.orig: Geodon may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Geodon can increase your risk of heart rhythm changes and has a higher risk of causing heart problems. It can also interact with other conditions and medicines that affect your heart, by lowering potassium and magnesium. You may need to have heart and blood tests before you start taking Geodon and during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS)
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal and involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Although the risk is lower compared to other antipsychotic medications, Geodon can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD), a potentially permanent condition. Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms.

Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls can happen because of a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as changing from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms don't go away, let your doctor know since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Geodon may cause harm to your unborn baby and should only be used if the benefit is greater than the risk. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications and don't use if you're breast-feeding.

basics.benefits_moa: Haloperidol is a traditional antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to change dopamine activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Haloperidol is okay for treating psychosis and agitation. It's less likely to cause weight gain than other antipsychotics, but it's more likely to cause other bad side effects.
downsides: It's an older medicine and has a lot more side effects than newer antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, it causes more hormone problems that can cause nipples to leak fluid, and sudden, dangerous abnormal heart rhythms.

Has a higher risk of extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS): movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements. One of these symptoms (called tardive dyskinesia) is permanent and more likely if you take this medicine for many years.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics have side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works best for you.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Latuda can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment, or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Latuda is not approved for children younger than age 18 years.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS)
risks_warnings.description: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS) is a rare, but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS) is a rare, but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. risks_warnings.title: Abnormal and involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Although the risk is lower compared to other antipsychotic medications, Latuda can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD), a potentially permanent condition. Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Risperdal is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Risperdal is good for treating psychosis, mania, and irritability. Among newer antipsychotic medicines, more likely to cause side effects, especially weight gain and hormone problems.
downsides: Mild to moderate risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Moderate risk of weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, higher risk of hormone problems that cause nipples to leak and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

carousel_items: Takes 4 to 6 weeks to see full effects on thoughts and mood.
Can cause dizziness and drowsiness.
For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
May cause weight gain and worsen cholesterol or blood sugar.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people with dementia shouldn't take it.

basics.benefits_moa: Zyprexa is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Zyprexa is good for treating psychosis, mania, and agitation. More likely to cause weight gain and sleepiness than other antipsychotics.
downsides: More likely to cause weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Might make you more sleepy than some antipsychotics.
Mild risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

downsides_processed.orig: More likely to cause weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Might make you more sleepy than some antipsychotics.
Mild risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

upsides: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms, manic episodes, and agitation in people with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
Lowers relapse rates for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
Antipsychotic medicines are all about equally effective.
Less likely to cause heart problems than some antipsychotics.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms, manic episodes, and agitation in people with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
Lowers relapse rates for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
Antipsychotic medicines are all about equally effective.
Less likely to cause heart problems than some antipsychotics.

drugs.one_liner: Helps control your thoughts and mood.

userStories.tip: Worked like a charm when nothing else would, but made me fat.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Took it at night for bipolar II in conjunction with other bipolar II meds. It did NOT work! It was like taking a sugar pill because it did nothing at all to help me. Not worth the time or the hope that it would help.
If prescribed, take it as prescribed! I take mine at bedtime, 1x day.  Has been a great med for me!
It worked for me, but I wish I had known what dose I needed.  When I received the right dose, it worked great.

Can cause dizziness and drowsiness.
For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
May cause weight gain and worsen cholesterol or blood sugar.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people with dementia shouldn't take it.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Zyprexa is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Zyprexa is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Zyprexa can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Zyprexa can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Zyprexa causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Zyprexa can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Zyprexa causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Zyprexa is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Zyprexa can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Zyprexa is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Zyprexa is more likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Zyprexa can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Zyprexa is more likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa can cause you to gain weight. Zyprexa is more likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Zyprexa can cause you to gain weight. Zyprexa is more likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Zyprexa impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

carousel_items: Drink plenty of water while taking this medication.
Take with food or milk to prevent an upset stomach.
It takes at least 2 to 6 weeks to experience the full benefit of this medication.
Your doctor can run blood tests to make sure the medication is working as it should.

clock.tip: Take after meals and drink plenty of water.

basics.benefits_moa: Allopurinol is a type of medicine called a xanthine oxidase inhibitor. It lowers uric acid levels in your blood, which prevents gout attacks and certain types of kidney stones.
basics.bottom_line: Allopurinol works well to prevent gout attacks and is cheaper than some alternatives, but it takes a few weeks to kick in.
downsides: Can actually increase the number of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
It can take 2 to 6 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
You should drink a lot of fluids to prevent kidney stones from forming while taking this medication.

downsides_processed.orig: Can actually increase the number of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
It can take 2 to 6 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
You should drink a lot of fluids to prevent kidney stones from forming while taking this medication.

upsides: Works well to lower the amount of uric acid in the body to reduce gout attacks.
Available as a generic medication.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to lower the amount of uric acid in the body to reduce gout attacks.
Available as a generic medication.

userStories.tip: I was taking Allopurinol from 2000. I underwent for an operation in the big toe and subsequently in Elbow joint due to Gout problem.

userStories.identifier: 51 years old slightly obese not fit
userStories.tip: I used to use it long term for gout prevention but essentially after a year i weaned off. Now if i get an inkling of an attack, I take about 1000mg and it works to stop the attack. I know that's not the indicated way, but
I couldn't exist without it.

I'm on just about the lowest dose available (100mg 2x daily) and my uric acid is very well controlled, plus I don't have to been too fussy with my diet (e.g., I can consume mushrooms, spinach, etc., and other relatively high purine foods).

drugs.name: Allopurinol

off-label_indications.indication: High uric acid from taking a thiazide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Drink plenty of water while taking this medication.
Take with food or milk to prevent an upset stomach.
It takes at least 2 to 6 weeks to experience the full benefit of this medication.
Your doctor can run blood tests to make sure the medication is working as it should.

risks_warnings.title: Increased gout attacks
risks_warnings.description: People who first start Allopurinol can experience increased gout attacks as they take the medication for the first few weeks. This is common. Your doctor can prescribe other medications to prevent these attacks from occurring.

description_processed.orig: People who first start Allopurinol can experience increased gout attacks as they take the medication for the first few weeks. This is common. Your doctor can prescribe other medications to prevent these attacks from occurring.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: People who take Allopurinol can be more likely to have kidney stones, especially if you're dehydrated. Drink at least 10 to 12 eight ounce glasses of water every day to help prevent that from happening.

description_processed.orig: People who take Allopurinol can be more likely to have kidney stones, especially if you're dehydrated. Drink at least 10 to 12 eight ounce glasses of water every day to help prevent that from happening.

risks_warnings.title: Skin rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people taking Allopurinol who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people taking Allopurinol who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver disease
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Allopurinol who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Allopurinol who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.
